exam_name: DNB PDCET - Diplomat National Board Post Diploma Centralized Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The National Board of Examination, (NBE) conducts the Diplomate of National Board Post-Diploma Centralised Entrance Test, DNB PDCET 2024 exam for admission to 1,073 seats across 14 specialities in 597 hospitals across India. The DNB PDCET 2024 was conducted on July 21. The authority announced the DNB PDCET result 2024 on August 21. Aspirants who have qualified for the exam will only be eligible to participate in the DNB PDCET counselling process conducted by NBE. The counselling of DNB PDCET 2024 will be conducted for speciality-specified on merit achieved in the entrance test. 

DNB PDCET 2024 Exam Details

DNB-PDCET is an essential pre-requisite entrance examination for granting admission to post-diploma DNB (broad specialities) postgraduate courses. The DNB PDECT 2024 exam is conducted in a computer-based mode in 18 test centres located across the country. A total of 120 multiple-choice questions are asked from 8 different specialities for the entrance test. As per the marking scheme of DNB PDCET, four marks are awarded for each correct attempt. There is a negative marking of 25%, therefore, one mark is deducted for each incorrect answer.

highlights.value: Diplomat National Board Post Diploma Centralized Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
All candidates applying for the entrance test must fulfil the DNB PDCET eligibility criteria as laid down by the exam conducting authority. The eligibility criteria of DNB PDCET 2024 reflect the basic pre-requisite conditions which must be met in order to be considered eligible to appear for the examination. The following are the eligibility criteria that the aspirants must fulfil. 

  • Candidates who have passed the final exam for a postgraduate diploma from a recognized Indian university.
  • Candidates must possess proof of having passed/passed the postgraduate diploma final examination on or before May 31, 2024.

application_process.html_content:
Filling of the DNB PDCET application form is a six-step process that included registration, filling of the application form, uploading of scanned images, choosing the test city, payment of application fee, and printing of filled application form. All candidates irrespective of their category will be required to pay Rs. 4,250 without taxes- as the application fee for DNB PDCET. 

Fileds that are non-editable in DNB PDCET application form 2024 once filled:

  • Name of the Candidate
  • Mobile Number
  • Email ID
  • Testing City
  • Nationality

Fields that can be edited in the DNB PDCET application form:

  • Date of Birth
  • Gender
  • Category of the Candidate

admit_card.html_content:
The exam conducting authority issues the DNB PDCET admit card 2024 for all the registered candidates. The admit card of DNB PDCET is a crucial document that reveals the designated test centres of the candidates. Candidates are required to carry the following documents to the examination centre in order to gain entry. Print out of DNB PDCET admit card 2024 to the exam centre along with

  • A government-authorized ID proof like Voter ID, Passport, Driving License and PAN card   (in original) 
  • A photocopy of permanent or provisional SMC/MCI registration. 

Candidates must furnish DNB PDCET 2024 admit card at the time of checking results and counselling thus it is necessary to retain it till the admission process concludes. Candidates are required to paste their latest photograph in the prescribed space on the admit card and report to the examination centre within the prescribed time.

counselling_process.html_content:
Aspirants who have cleared the entrance test and fulfilled the other eligibility criteria are eligible to participate in DNB PDCET counselling 2024.  The result of DNB PDCET counselling, indicates the roll number, rank, category, speciality, college/hospital name and state. Candidates who are included in the counselling results need to freeze the allotted seat and mandatorily have to download DNB PDCET 2024 allotment letter for round one. Aspirants will have to report at the designated college along with documents for verification and the DNB PDCET admission process. After the completion of the admission process, the authorities will conduct the subsequent rounds of counselling of DNB PDCET 2024. 

A total of four rounds of DNB PDCET 2024 counselling are being organised wherein the first three will be online and the last round will be conducted in offline mode at the NBE office, in New Delhi. Those candidates who will not register in the first round of counselling will not be allowed to participate in further rounds. After registration, candidates are required to fill preference of course and college for DNB PDCET admission. Candidates with merit positions will be allowed to fill their option/choices after remitting the required counselling fee of Rs 2500/- Based on the choices given and the availability of seats, admission will be granted to specific specialities. To check the seat matrix for 14 broad specialities.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The exam pattern of DNB PDCET acquaints the candidates with the details of the entrance exams like the duration, the number of questions, types of questions, etc. With the help of the DNB PDCET 2024 exam pattern candidates are required to formulate a solid strategy to crack the entrance test.  

NBE conducts the exam in computer-based mode, consisting of 120 multiple-choice questions with a single best answer. For every correct answer, candidates are awarded 4 marks and one mark will be deducted for each incorrect answer. The exam is conducted only in English medium. The syllabus of DNB PDCET 2024 is based on the MBBS exit level.

exam_name: NExT - National Exit Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The National Exit Test, or NExT exam, is a national-level entrance test conducted by the All India Institute of Medical Sciences. AIIMS, New Delhi. The NMC NExt exam will act as a replacement for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Postgraduates (NEET PG) and the Foreign Medical Graduates Examination (FMGE). 

The NExT exam will be held twice a year in the month of February and August. However, as per the latest update, the NExT 2024 exam will  be conducted in October, 2024 (tentative). Candidates must secure 50 percent marks to clear the National Exit Test and there will be no limit on attempts for the NExT exam. Earlier the NExT mock test was scheduled on July 28, 2023 but later, it was cancelled by the NMC and the registration fee was refunded to the aspirants.

NExT will be conducted in computer-based mode. A total of 120 questions will be asked for a duration of 180 minutes. The NExT official bulletin mentions essential details such as the application process, fees, exam centre eligibility criteria, exam pattern, and other important details. Eligible candidates will be able to fill out the NExT registration form on or before the deadline. 

As per the NExT exam pattern, the NExT exam will be held in two steps - NExT Step 1 and NExT Step 2. Step 1 will be theory based carrying MCQ-type questions, while Step 2 will be a practical exam. A total of 540 questions will be asked in the NExT Step 1 paper. Aspirants need to obtain at least a minimum of 50% marks to pass NExT Step 1. Through NExt scores, admissions for PG medical courses will be granted, which will allow foreign medical graduates to practice medicine in India.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates wishing to appear in NExT must meet the following eligibility criteria as set by the NMC. Check the below mentioned eligibility criteria for NExT:

  • All undergraduate medical students with a valid MBBS degree are eligible.

  • Aspirants pursuing MBBS from an institution recognised by the Medical Council of India (MCI) are eligible. 

  • All Foreign Medical Graduates who wish to register and practice medicine in India can appear in NExT exam.

  • Any person with a medical degree wishing to pursue PG in medicine or an academic course approved by NMC can apply.

application_process.html_content:
The NExT application form can be filled out using the steps mentioned below. 

  • Basic Registration: Candidates will have to first complete the basic registration form by filling out personal information, uploading images of their photo, signature, left thumb impression, and generating their registration ID and password. The confirmation will be emailed to the applicant’s registered email. An Exam Unique Code (EUC) is generated afresh for any instance of exam in relation to NExT. 

  • Filling NExT application form: The next step is to login using the registration ID and password and fill out the application form for NExT exam. 

  • Payment of the application fee: After filling out the application form, candidates will now have to pay the application fee. The application form fee is Rs. 2000 (Rs. 1000 for SC/ST/EWS applicants). Persons with disabilities are exempt from exam fees.

admit_card.html_content:
The admit card for the NExt exam will be issued to all the aspirants who have submitted their application forms. The NExt admit card can be downloaded from the official website by using the registration ID and password. 

The admit card for the NExT mock/practice test will be available online for all registered candidates. Aspirants must follow the instructions carefully as mentioned in the NExT prospectus to avoid rejection of their application for a mock/practice test. The conducting authority will not send the NExT admit card by email or post.

counselling_process.html_content: N/A

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The NExT exam will be held in two phases: Step 1 and Step 2. Candidates must be familiar with the NExT exam for MBBS pattern. The step wise detailed NExT exam pattern PDF will include the number of questions, weightage, time duration and others. .

NExT Step 2 exam pattern

The NExT Paper 2 is practical/ viva voce examination that will be held after the completion of the internship. The exam will be objectively structured and clinical case based with simulated cases/ patients. Step 2 will be held in person /live and conducted by the respective state health universities / institutions. Candidates will be declared pass/fail based on the appropriate competence, which will be evaluated. 

Distribution of subjects in NExT Step 2
A total of seven subjects will be determined in NExT step 2. These include:

  • Surgery and allied subjects

  • Obstetrics and Gynaecology

exam_name: JENPAS UG - Joint Entrance Test for Nursing, Paramedical and Allied Sciences Under Graduate Courses
conducting_body: West Bengal Joint Entrance Examinations Board

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The West Bengal Joint Entrance Examinations Board (WBJEEB) is the authority to conduct the Joint Entrance Test for Nursing, Paramedical, and Allied Sciences Undergraduate Exam, JENPAS UG. As per the latest update, the authority has announced the JENPAS UG 2024 result at the official website, wbjeeb.nic.in. The state-level entrance exam in West Bengal, JENPAS UG was held on June 30, 2024. The JENPAS UG application form window was available from March 22, 2024 to April 22, 2024. 

The JENPAS correction window 2024 was live from April 24 to April 26. Candidates could edit their information in the JENPAS application form through this correction window. The questions asked in the JENPAS UG 2024 exam are multiple-choice based on Class 11 and 12 standard syllabi. JENPAS UG 2024 admit card is issued in online mode from June 20. Registered candidates will be able to download JENPAS admit card 2024 by logging through their application number and password. The JENPAS UG 2024 exam is held in the computer-based (online) mode in English and Bengali language. 

Candidates qualifying for the class 12 examination from any recognized Board/Council can apply for JENPAS UG 2024 online mode at wbjeeb.nic.in. Through JENPAS UG 2024, admission will be granted to around 4230 nursing, paramedical, and allied sciences seats. 

Admission through JENPAS UG 2024 will be offered in various Colleges/ Institutes in the following undergraduate courses.

  • B.Sc. Nursing (Bachelor of Nursing)

  • B.P.T. (Bachelor of Physiotherapy)

  • B.M.L.T (Bachelor of Medical Laboratory Technology)

  • B.Sc. CCT (B.Sc. in Critical Care Technology)

  • B.Sc. OTT (BSc. in Operation Theatre Technology)

  • B.Sc. PT (B.Sc. in Perfusion Technology)

  • B.Sc. PA (BSc. in Physician Assistant)

  • B.Sc. MMB (B. Sc. In Medical Microbiology)

  • B.H.A. (Bachelor in Hospital Administration)

highlights.value: Joint Entrance Test for Nursing, Paramedical and Allied Sciences Under Graduate Courses
West Bengal Joint Entrance Examinations Board

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Before appearing for JENPAS UG 2024, aspirants have to apply by fulfilling the eligibility criteria. 

The eligibility criteria to appear for JENPAS 2024 are as follows.

  • The applicant must be a citizen of India.

  • The applicant must have passed already OR must be appearing in 2024 in class 12 in the (10+2) system only.

  • The applicant's age must be at least 17 (seventeen) years as on December 31, 2024, i.e., the applicant should have been born on or before December 31, 2007

application_process.html_content:
Authorities releases the JENPAS UG 2024 application form in online mode. The stepwise procedure the complete the JENPAS 2024 application process is mentioned below. 

Registration

  • Enter personal details such as name, father's name, mother's name, date of birth, gender, identification type and number, present and permanent address, mobile number, email ID etc.

  • Then the candidate has to create a password, choose a security question/ answer, review and submit the registration.

  • An application number will be generated and will appear on the screen. Also, SMS/email will be sent to the candidate.

  • Candidate must remember his/her application number, password, and security question/answer. If the candidate forgets the password, he/she has to recover it through the “Forgot Password” option. 

  • There is no other way to recover the password.

  • It is not possible for any person/agency to change/edit/input any information without knowing the password.

Filling out the application form

  • At this stage, the candidate needs to fill up various other information such as, domicile, 

  • category, PWD status, family income status, religion, nationality, academic details etc.

  • Candidates need to select his/her option for i) Paper-I only or ii) Paper-II only or iii) both Paper-I and Paper-II.

  • Thereafter the candidate needs to choose zones of examinations in order of his/her choice and submit the application.

Uploading of images

  • The candidate is required to upload JPG/JPEG images of his/her recent color photograph (10 to 200kB) and signature (4 to 30 kB).

  • If any document e.g., certificate/marksheet etc. is to be uploaded, it must be in PDF format (50 to 300kB)

Payment of examination fees

  • The JENPAS UG examination fees can be paid by Net Banking/ Debit Card/ Credit Card only.

  • For only Paper-1 or only Paper-2, the application fee for the examination is Rs.500 (Rs.400 for SC/ST/OBC-A/OBC-B candidates), plus the Bank's service charges as applicable.

  • For both Paper-1 and Paper-2, the application fee for the examination is Rs.1800 (Rs.1650 for SC/ST/OBC-A/OBC-B candidates), plus the Bank's service charges as applicable.

Confirmation Page: On successful completion of all the above steps, candidates can download the ’Confirmation Page' which means that the application is complete.

JENPAS UG Application Correction Window

The JENPAS 2024 correction window will be made available by WBJEEB on the official website from April 24 to April 26. If any candidate intends to correct any other information in his/her JENPAS UG application form 2024, he/she can do so after logging in during the given correction period. Any request for any JENPAS UG 2024 correction will not be entertained by WBJEEB under any circumstances beyond the correction period.

admit_card.html_content:
The JENPAS admit card 2024 will be released in online mode on June 20. Candidates will be able to download the JENPAS UG admit card 2024 till June 30. Candidates must carry a printed hard copy of the admit card to the examination centre. To download the JENPAS UG 2024 admit card, aspirants can check the steps to download the JENPAS UG hall ticket below.

  • Visit wbjeeb.nic.in and click on JENPAS UG 2024 tab.

  • Upon reaching the JENPAS UG 2024 website, click on the link admit card link.

  • Login by entering user ID and password

  • The admit card of JENPAS UG 2024 will be displayed on the screen

  • Verify all the details mentioned in JENPAS admit card

  • Download and take a printout of the JENPAS UG hall ticket 2024

counselling_process.html_content:
WBJEEB releases a separate notification with details of JENPAS UG 2024 counselling/seat allotment and admission procedure. The JENPAS counselling process will be published in the Board's website soon after the publication of the result.

The course-wise and institute-wise availability of seats which will be provided by the competent authorities will also be published before counselling and allotment. All verifications of documents uploaded while filling out the application process will be done during counselling.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The JENPAS UG 2024 exam pattern includes crucial details of the exam such as mode, medium, number of papers, type of questions and mode. The same can be checked below.

  • The test will consist of two papers namely, Paper-I and Paper-II.

  • Paper-II is for admission in the BHA course only and Paper-I is for other courses.

  • During application, a candidate can apply for only Paper-I or only Paper-II or for both.

exam_name: AAU VET - Assam Agricultural University Veterinary Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Assam Agricultural University Veterinary Entrance Test (AAU VET) is a state-level entrance examination conducted by the Assam Agricultural University to admit students into various undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programs of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry. 

To appear in the examination, candidates will have to fill out the AAU VET 2023 application form. The entrance exam will be held in computer-based mode in three different cities of Assam namely, Guwahati, Jorhat and Biswanath Charialli. 

As per the AAU VET exam pattern 2023, a total of 150 questions will be asked in the examination and candidates will have to complete the test within 2 hours. The question paper will be divided into two sections, sections A & B. Section A will contain 45 questions each from Physics and Chemistry whereas section B will contain 30 questions each from Zoology and Botany. 

AAU VET is held once a year for admission to Bachelor of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry (BVSc & AH) and Master of Veterinary Science (MVSc) courses.

highlights.value: Assam Agricultural University Veterinary Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates must fulfil the eligibility criteria of AAU VET 2023 to appear for the entrance exam. Check the below-mentioned eligibility criteria for AAU VET 2023.

Eligibility criteria for BVSc & AH program

  • Candidates must have passed class 12 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry and Biology/Agriculture as main subjects from a recognized board including NIOS. 

  • Candidates belonging to the General/OBC/UPS category must have secured a minimum of 50% aggregate marks whereas those belonging to SC/ST/DAC category must have secured a minimum of 40% aggregate. 

  • The minimum age of candidates should be 17 years and the maximum age should be 25 years, on or before December 31, 2023.

Eligibility criteria for MVSc program

  • A candidate must have passed the B.Sc. (Agri)/ B.Sc. (Hort.)/ B.Sc. (Seri.)/ B.Sc (Agri. Biotech)/ B.Sc. (Hons) Agriculture/ Horticulture/ B.Sc.(H.Sc.)/ B.Sc. (Hons) Community Science/ B.F.Sc./ B.Tech (Fishery Science) of 4 years duration/ B.V.Sc & A.H. of 5 or 5 and half years duration from a recognized university. 

  • Candidates must have secured a minimum CGPA of 2.60/4.00 scale or 3.25/5.00 scale or 6.60/10.00 scale for Gen/OBC/UPS category and 2.20/4.00 or 2.75/5.00 or 5.60/10.00 for SC/ST/DAC.

  • In case the Grade points are not awarded, the candidate must have secured at least 60% marks for General/OBC/UPS category and 50% marks for SC/ST/DAC category.

application_process.html_content:
The application process for AAU VET 2023 needs to be done in online mode. The detailed process has been described below. 

AAU VET 2023 application form process

  • Registration: Visit the online registration portal at aau.ac.in and enter basic details such as a valid email ID, contact number, and more. After successful registration, the login ID and password will be sent to the registered email ID and phone number. 

  • Fee payment: Login using the login ID and password and select the category. Candidates will then be redirected to the payment gateway for fee payment. 

  • Filling out the application form: After successful fee payment, candidates will have to fill out the application form by entering their personal and academic details and uploading the documents.

exam_name: CNET - Common Nursing Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical University, ABVMU Lucknow conducts the state-level ABVMU BSc Nursing common entrance exam, known as CNET for its 4-year B.Sc Nursing program. The entrance is conducted for admissions to 11610 B.Sc nursing seats in nursing colleges affiliated to ABVMU Lucknow, SGPGIMS Lucknow, KGMU Lucknow, RMLIMS Lucknow, UPUMS Saifai and all government and private deemed universities of Uttar Pradesh. 

The authority announced the CNET result 2024 on June 22. Candidates can check their CNET 2024 result by logging in using their registration ID and password. The registration window for the Round 1 counselling for the CNET 2024 was from June 22 to June 28. The CNET 2024 application forms were available from April 25 to May 29, 2024. The  CNET 2024 exam date was June 14. Along with the application form, the authority has released the information brochure. The aspirants will have to fill out the CNET 2024 application form through the official website abvmuup.edu.in. The CNET admit card were released on June 5 in online mode. No application form or admit card of ABVMU BSc Nursing is received or released by post or any other means.  

The CNET 2024 exam will only be conducted in the English language in pen and paper mode in an OMR sheet and will consist of 200 MCQs and will be of 200 marks. As per the CNET 2024 exam pattern duration will be 3 hours and 20 minutes and there will be no negative marking. After the successful completion of the exam, the CNET 2024 result will be declared by the conducting authority. The qualified students will be invited for the two rounds of CNET 2024 counselling followed by a mop-up round.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates appearing for the CNET 2024 can check the eligibility guidelines for B.Sc Nursing from the table mentioned below. 

CNET 2024 eligibility 

Course

Eligibility 

B.Sc Nursing

  • The candidate should be a domicile of Uttar Pradesh and should fall in the age bracket of 17 - 35 years as on or before December 31, 2024. 

  • The candidate should have passed the 10 + 2 or its equivalent from a recognised board with a minimum of 45% marks in Physics, Chemistry and Biology with English as a compulsory subject. 


CNET 2024 reservation 

Reservation in the ABVMU BSc nursing program is given for the sanctioned seats by the Indian Nursing Council as per the state government reservation policy. A 5% horizontal reservation is given to the physically handicapped candidates and an EWS quota of 10% may be admissible as per the directives of the UP government.

application_process.html_content:
The steps to fill up the application form of CNET 2024 are as follows:

  • Go to the official website abvmuup.edu.in and click on the link for CNET 2024
  • Click on the “Register” button and fill in all the details asked in it such as - the candidate's name, parental details, date of birth, age, gender, a valid email address and a valid mobile number.  
  • Upon successful registration, aspirants will receive the registration ID number on the registered email address and phone number. 
  • Login using the registration ID and DOB to successfully log into the “CNET 2024 Applicant Dashboard”.
  • Click on the “Pay fee for B.Sc Nursing” button and pay the application fee in online mode via debit or credit card, net banking or UPI. Once the payment is confirmed, click on the “Fill form” button. 
  • The personal information mentioned in the registration form will be auto-filled in the application form. 
  • Enter the permanent and communication address.
  • Enter the educational qualification details such as 10th and 12th standard.
  • Choose any 3 exam centres as per preference and click on submit.
  • Upload a digital photo, signature and the verification form in the prescribed format. The verification form will be available on the “Applicant dashboard” and should have been duly filled before uploading it. 
  • Enter the bank account details and click on the “Confirm & Preview” button to go to the final submission form.
  • Check all the details mentioned in the application form carefully and then click on the “Final Submit” button.

Photo upload guidelines: The uploaded photograph should be in a white background and in JPG format only. The size should be between 50 - 200 kb with a dimension of 4.5 cm * 3.5 cm.

Signature guidelines: The signature should be in white background in JPG format only and the size should be between 50 - 200 Kb. 

Note: There is no correction window available and hence the students are advised to fill out the application form carefully. After the successful submission, a confirmation email will be sent to the registered email ID.

admit_card.html_content:
The successfully registered students will be able to download the CNET exam 2024 admit card from the official website by logging in with their registration ID and date of birth. Carrying the CNET 2024 hall tickets at the exam centre is mandatory to be allowed to sit for the test. 

How to download the CNET 2024 admit card?

  1. Open the official website of ABVMU and click on the link provided for downloading the admit card.

  2. Enter the registration ID and date of birth and log in.

  3. Once the CNET exam 2024 admit card is displayed, cross-check it and download the same.

  4. Take a coloured printout of the admit card once all the details have been cross-checked.

counselling_process.html_content:
After the CNET result declaration, the conducting body will release the first merit list of the aspirants qualified in the test with common merit rank. The candidates will have to pay Rs.500 as the counselling registration fee and Rs.5000 (refundable if not allotted a seat) as the counselling security fee through the online mode. Students failing to do so will not be considered in the counselling process. 

The candidate will have to pay a seat confirmation fee of Rs 40,000 through online or a bank challan. This amount will be adjusted against the tuition fee, once the counselling process is over. 

Steps for CNET 2024 counseling and seat allocation

  • Candidates will have to register for the CNET 2024 counselling by payment of Rs.500 as the counselling registration fee and Rs.5000 as the security fee. 

  • The admission cell will allot the seats from the candidate’s preferred institute based on the common merit rank and respective category rank.

  • Check the allotted seat on the website, and lock/confirm the allocation by paying Rs 40,000, it is not possible to change the choice in particular counselling after locking the seat after completion of payment. 

  • Seats will be allotted as per the rank in the 1st round of counselling. A candidate who is allotted a seat shall be admitted provisionally, he/she should report to the selected institute for document verification. Without a valid document or insufficient document or mismatch the seat will be cancelled.

  • Once documents are verified, he/she shall be offered provisional admission & must pay the balance prescribed fee online within the stipulated period. If the candidate is unwilling or fails to pay the balance admission fee within a specified period as mentioned by the authority, seats will be marked as Vacant & Seat booking fee will be forfeited.

  • After the payment of the admission fee, the candidate will be granted admission. 

A total of 2 rounds of counselling will be conducted to fill up the seats and will be followed by an online/offline on-campus mop-up round. After the completion of round 1 of the counselling, the candidate will be eligible for seat upgrade/reshuffle in round 2 counselling. If any candidate reshuffles their existing seat and gets a new upgraded seat in round 2, his/her round 1 allotted seat will be automatically cancelled.

faqs.answer: CNET 2024 offers admissions to a total of 11610 B.Sc nursing seats in various medical colleges of Uttar Pradesh.

faqs.answer: No, you cannot get admission to ABVMU and other affiliated colleges through the NEET exam for BSc Nursing. You will have to appear separately for the CNET 2024.

faqs.question: What is the difficulty level of the CNET 2024 exam?
faqs.answer: The difficulty level of CNET 2024 exam is easy to moderate. The questions asked are generally of the 10 + 2 standard.

exam_name: NEET SS - National Eligibility cum Entrance Test Super Specialty

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The National Board of Examinations (NBE) conducts the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Super Specialty, also known as NEET SS, for admission to 2,447 Doctorate of Medicine (DM) and Master of Chirurgie (MCh) seats in 156 institutes across India. 

The National Board of Examinations (NBE) conducts the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Super Speciality, NEET SS. As per the latest update, NEET SS 2024 has been announced. As per the official notification, NBE will coduct the NEET SS 2024 tentativley on March 29 & 30, 2025. The NEET SS 2024 registration is conducted on nbe.edu.in along with the release of the information brochure. The NBE NEET SS 2024 information brochure mentions the important details related to the exam such as eligibility, registration process, fees and more. 

Based on registration, the hall tickets for the NEET SS 2024 are released on the official website. Each candidate is required to carry the admit card at the NEET SS 2024 exam centre on the exam day. The NEET SS exam will be conducted in a computer-based mode wherein 100 multiple-choice questions will be asked.

NEET SS result is released on the official website in PDF format. Only candidates securing the NEET SS cut-off percentile are considered qualified for the entrance exam. The cutoff scores for NEET SS 2024 are announced along with the results for 32 super-specialities. Those who will qualify for the exam will only be eligible to download the NEET SS 2024 scorecard. Based on the NEET SS 2024 result, eligible candidates will be called for the NEET SS 2024 counselling process, which will be conducted by the Medical Counselling Committee (MCC). 

A total of 2 rounds will be conducted in the NEET SS 2024 counselling, wherein, candidates will be required to enter their choice of courses and colleges. Based on the choices filled, seats available, NEET SS rank, reservation criteria, and other factors, admission to DM and MCh seats are granted. Aspirants selected for NEET SS 2024 counselling will be required to report to the designated colleges for verification of documents and the admission process.

highlights.value: National Eligibility cum Entrance Test Super Specialty

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates must fulfil the eligibility criteria of NEET SS 2024 to appear for the entrance exam. The following are the NEET SS eligibility criteria for 2024 which can be checked below.

  • For appearing in NEET SS, aspirants are required to hold a postgraduate degree (MD/MS/DNB) or any equivalent examination.
  • Aspirants who complete their Postgraduate degree are eligible to apply for NEET SS 2024 Candidates without a degree will not be allowed to fill out the application form.
  • Applicants must have a provisional or permanent registration certificate issued by the State Medical Council (SMC) or Medical Council of India (MCI), which they must also furnish at the time of examination.

NEET SS eligibility criteria for foreign nationals:

Foreign nationals who wish to take the NEET SS examination for admission to a particular speciality can fulfil certain eligibility criteria:

  • MCI registration certificate is not required by the Non-Resident Indians to appear for NEET SS but they need to be registered with the respective medical authority of their country.
  • Temporary registration will be provided to such candidates till the duration of the postdoctoral degree after qualifying for the exam.
  • This registration will be limited to the college/institution to which anyone gets admission into.

application_process.html_content:
Only those candidates who fulfil the eligibility criteria can fill the NEET SS application form 2024 in five steps mentioned below.

1. NEET SS registration 2024

2. Filling out the application form

3. Uploading requisite documents and choosing the exam centres

4. Payment of application fees

5. Printout of the confirmation page

How to fill NEET SS application form 2024?

Aspirants can check the details procedure to fill out the application form below.

Step 1 - NEET SS registration 

In this step, aspirants need to register themselves by visiting the official website. Then, click on the new registration tab and enter your personal, contact details as well as the captcha code. Verify the details mentioned in the NEET SS application form and submit it. A confirmation message will be sent to the registered mobile number and email ID mentioning the user ID and password.

Step 2 - Filling NEET SS 2024 application form

Using the login credentials, user ID and password, aspirants need to log in to their NEET SS applicant portal. Thereafter, click on the link to fill NEET SS application form and enter the personal, academic, contact and other information. It is important to enter the details carefully.

Step 3 - Uploading the documents and choosing exam centres

Here, aspirants need to upload a passport-size photograph, signature and left-hand thumb impression at the time of filling out the application form for NEET SS 2024. The documents to be uploaded should be done as per the specifications mentioned by NBE. The specifications of documents mentioned for the NEET SS 2024 application form have been mentioned below.

After uploading relevant documents at the time of NEET SS application form 2024 candidates need to provide their preferences of exam centres in which they wish to take the exam. Based on the choices of exam cities, the authority will allot the test centre on a first come first serve basis. Aspirants need to choose the preferences of NEET SS 2024 exam cities as per their convenience. 

Step 4 - Payment of application fees

Once the application process for NEET SS 2024 is over, aspirants need to pay the application fees of Rs. 4250 irrespective of all categories in online mode through credit/debit cards and net banking. For the successful submission of the NEET SS application form 2024, it is crucial to pay the registration fees. No one can proceed further without payment of the application fee.

Step 5 - Printout of the confirmation page

After the successful submission of the NEET SS 2024 application form, the confirmation page will be displayed on the screen. This confirmation page of the NEET SS application form will mention the name of candidates, personal, academic, contact and other details. Such details need to be verified before downloading it and must be reserved for future reference.

admit_card.html_content:
NEET SS 2024 admit card will be released for candidates whose application forms are accepted by the authority. It is important to download the NEET SS admit card 2024 as it should be carried along with other documents at the time of examination and during the counselling process. 

To download NEET SS admit card 2024 aspirants need to submit their User ID and password as provided by filling out the application form. NEET SS 2024 admit card will be displayed on the screen mentioning the name of candidates, roll number, application number, date of birth, the speciality chosen, exam date, time of exam, exam centre name and address and other exam day guidelines to be followed

counselling_process.html_content:
The counselling of NEET SS 2024 will be conducted by Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) for admission to 2447 DM and MCh seats. A total of two rounds will be conducted wherein, candidates will be required to register for each round separately. After the NEET SS counselling registration process for each round, aspirants will need to provide their preferences of colleges as well as specializations into which they wish to take admission. On the basis of these preferences, NEET SS rank, seat availability, reservation criteria and other factors, the seat allotment of NEET SS 2024 will be done. 

Once the seats will be allotted, shortlisted candidates will need to report at the respective college for completion of the admission process and document verification. Before reporting at the colleges, aspirants will need to download the NEET SS allotment letter indicating the personal details, category rank, date and time to report at the colleges. In case, if the candidate is not satisfied with the allotted college, he/she can opt an option for withdrawal/refusal and can appear for NEET SS counselling subsequent rounds.

exam_name: RUHS BSc Nursing - Rajasthan University Of Health Sciences Bachelor of Science in Nursing

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Rajasthan University of Health Sciences, Jaipur (RUHS) conducts the RUHS B.Sc nursing 2024 entrance exam for admissions to the 4-year B.Sc nursing courses in colleges affiliated with RUHS, Jaipur. As per the latest update, the authority will release the RUHS B.Sc nursing counselling dates soon. The RUHS BSc nursing result 2024 was announced on September 5 at the official website: bscnursing2024.com. The exam date for the RUHS BSc Nursing 2024 exam was August 11, 2024. 

Candidates must fill out the RUHS BSc nursing application form 2024 within the dates provided by the conducting body. Registered aspirants are issued RUHS BSc nursing admit card 2024 before the exam. RUHS 2024 hall ticket is an important document to carry at the exam centre. Students without a hard copy of the admit card are not permitted inside the RUHS BSc nursing exam centre. 

The RUHS B.Sc nursing exam is conducted in the English and Hindi language in offline mode at Jaipur only. The exam consists of 100 MCQ’s and the total exam duration is 2 hours.  For every correct answer, +1 mark is awarded while there is no negative marking for a wrong answer. After the successful completion of the exam, the RUHS B.Sc nursing result is announced by the authority online. The qualified candidates are invited for the RUHS B.Sc nursing counselling for admission.

highlights.value: Rajasthan University Of Health Sciences Bachelor of Science in Nursing

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates appearing for the RUHS B.Sc nursing exam can check the eligibility guidelines mentioned below. 

  • A Candidate should have passed the 10+2 standard in science or equivalent

  • The candidate should have scored an aggregate of a minimum of 45% marks in Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and English together. (40% for the reserved category)

RUHS B.Sc reservation 

The reservation of seats is made subject to statutory provisions of Govt. of Rajasthan for Rajasthan domicile candidates. Candidates belonging to reservation categories of states other than Rajasthan are allotted seats in the un-reserved category. 

PwD reservation: 5% seats are reserved on merit-cum-priority in each category horizontally.

application_process.html_content:
The steps to fill out the RUHS BSc nursing application form are as follows.

  1. Go to ruhsraj.org and click “Admissions” to create a profile. If you are a new user, click on “New User? Create Account”. If you have already created a profile, then login with the ID and password.

  2. Fill in the personal details with appropriate data

  3. Fill in the parental details, address and additional details asked in the application form

  4. Fill in the marks of class 12th properly and upload all the documents 

  1. An OTP will be sent to the registered mobile number. Enter the OTP and complete the signup process

  2. Login using the ID and password received upon registration

  3. Click on “Admission”. select “B.Sc nursing” and click on “Apply Now”

  4. Cross-check all the information and click on “Review & Confirm”

  5. Pay the application fee as prescribed by RUHS, Jaipur and take a printout of the fee receipt for future reference. The Application fee is Rs.1,800 for the general category and Rs.900 for the SC/ST/PWD category. 

  6. After the successful payment of the application fee, go to the dashboard and click on “My Application”, select “Print Application Form” and click on “Go”

Note: RUHS, Jaipur provides no correction window for the B.Sc nursing application and hence the candidates are advised to fill out the application form carefully.

admit_card.html_content:
The RUHS B.Sc nursing admit card 2024 is provided online at the official website. The registered candidates need to download the same by logging in with their credentials. Carrying a hard copy of the RUHS B.Sc nursing admit card at the exam centre is mandatory to be allowed to sit for the test. 

How to download the RUHS B.Sc nursing admit card?

  1. Open the official website of RUHS, Jaipur and click on the link provided for downloading the admit card

  2. Enter the ID and password received during the application registration

  3. Once the admit card is displayed, cross-check it and download the same

  4. Take a printout of the admit card

counselling_process.html_content:
After the result declaration, the conducting body releases the merit list of the aspirants qualified in the RUHS B.Sc nursing with a common merit rank. The candidate needs to book the seat online as per his/her choice by making a payment of Rs. 550 (non-refundable/ non-adjustable). 

The candidate will have to pay an amount of Rs. 50,000/-  once the seat is allotted. This fee is adjusted or deducted from the admission fees of respective institutes. If the candidate leaves this seat, then he/she is subjected to a penalty of Rs.50,000. 

85% of the total seats will be filled up by the bona fide candidates of Rajasthan, and 15% of the total seats will be filled up by the candidates on an All India basis inclusive of Rajasthan as per state government guidelines. The percentage of female candidates shall not fall below 50% of the total seats in all categories.

RUHS B.Sc nursing colleges allotment

The allotment of college and course is made by strictly following the order of merit, seats available in each college, the priority of choice/option of the college and the course filled in by the aspirant in the online application form.  Candidates securing equal scores in the admission test are admitted in the following order of preference: 

  1. One who has passed 10+2 or an equivalent examination in less number of attempts. 

  2. The candidate of higher age (older candidate).

  3. One who has obtained higher marks in the Secondary examination (10th) or its equivalent examination. 

After allotment of college and course, candidates are informed about their allotment at the RUHS website. Candidates are required to take a printout of the allotment letter and join at the allotted college with this printout along with requisite documents, in original, and prescribed fee, by the notified date.

exam_name: KGMU BSc Nursing - KGMU BSc Nursing Exam

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical University (ABVMU) Lucknow conducted the KGMU B.Sc nursing exam (CNET 2024) this year for candidates who wish to pursue the four-year B.Sc nursing program, also known as the Bachelor of Science in Nursing, which is highly sought after among medical enthusiasts in KGMU Lucknow. 

Authority announced the KGMU BSc nursing result 2024 on June 22 and the result was declared on June 14. The registration window for the Round 1 counselling for the CNET 2024 was from June 22 to June 28. As per the latest update, the result of round 2 counselling is out by the authority.

The KGMU B.Sc nursing 2024 exam is conducted in the English language online mode and consists of 100 MCQs. As per the KGMU BSc Nursing 2024 exam pattern, the duration will be 1.5 hours, and no negative marking will occur. After completing the exam, the KGMU B.Sc nursing 2024 result is declared by the conducting authority. The qualified candidates are invited to the KGMU B.Sc nursing 2024 counselling, which is held online.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates appearing for the KGMU B.Sc nursing 2024 can check the eligibility guidelines for the course from the table mentioned below. 

  • The candidate must be a citizen of India.

  • Candidates must have passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Biology as the mandatory subjects with a minimum of 45% marks for the unreserved category and 40% for the reserved category. 

  • The applicants should be at least 17 years old by December 31, 2024. The upper age limit is set at 35 years as of December 31, 2024.

application_process.html_content:
Mentioned below are the steps to fill up the application form for the KGMU B.Sc nursing entrance examination:

  • Visit the official website abvmuup.edu.in

  • Proceed by clicking on the applicant login and completing the registration process. This entails entering the email address and mobile number for registration purposes. 

  • An OTP will be sent for verification. 

  • Following this, log in and diligently fill out the application form with all the academic details. Exercise caution while providing this information, as there will be no opportunity for later modifications.

  • Candidates will next upload their signature and photograph onto the KGMU B.Sc Nursing 2024 application form. 

  • Once the form is filled out, the requisite fees must be paid. 

  • The last step is to obtain a hard copy of the KGMU B.Sc. Nursing 2024 application form for future reference.

admit_card.html_content:
The hall ticket for KGMU B.Sc Nursing 2024 will be issued before the examination. Candidates must have their admit card in possession to gain entry to the examination venue on the day of the test. Candidates can also get the KGMU BSc Nursing 2024 admit card offline from the university office by making a payment of Rs 100. The admit card will also feature pertinent details regarding the KGMU BSc Nursing exam schedule and the location of the test centre. One can access the admit card through the official website of KGMU.

How to download the KGMU admit card?

  • Go to abvmuup.edu.in.

  • Select the KGMU B.Sc nursing admit card link.

  • Fill in the registration number and password.

  • The admit card will be displayed on the screen.

  • Afterwards, applicants can proceed to download and print the admit card for the examination.

counselling_process.html_content:
Qualifying candidates are invited for the KGMU BSc Nursing 2024 counselling which is conducted in the online mode. The steps to take part in the counselling of KGMU 2024 are as follows: 

  • Applicants need to submit a non-refundable fee of Rs 300 through Bank draft to participate in the counselling process.

  •  A separate bank draft of Rs 5000 also has to be deposited by the candidates at the time of counselling on the award of seat. 

  • However, the money will be returned to the candidate upon his/her joining of the KGMU BSc nursing course and if the candidate opts for a seat and does not join then the University will forfeit that money.

exam_name: JGEEBILS - Joint Graduate Entrance Examination for Biology and Interdisciplinary Life Sciences

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Tata Institute of Fundamental Research conducts the Joint Graduate Entrance Examination for Biology and Interdisciplinary Life Sciences (JGEEBILS). JGEEBILS 2025 is a common entrance examination to offer admission in Integrated M.Sc-Ph.D, M.Sc and PhD graduate programmes. The complete schedule of JGEEBILS 2025 has been released by the authority. JGEEBILS 2025 exam will be conducted on December 8, 2024. A total of 19 institutes are participating to grant admission through the JGEEBILS 2025 exam. 

TIFR Nationwide Entrance Examination for Biology, JGEEBILS is held in the computer-based mode for a time duration of 2 hours and 30 minutes across 59 cities. A total of 60 questions are asked from general, physics, chemistry and biology subjects. 1 mark is awarded to each correct answer in section A and  2 marks for section B. 0.5 marks are deducted for each incorrect answer. 

Candidates who wish to join the TIFR JGEEBILS institutions for the respective programmes will have to appear for the written test to secure admissions. All the participating institutions use the JGEEBILS score as a part of their admission process, but each institution has its own admission procedure. Students need to apply separately to each JGEEBILS participating institution by visiting each institution's website.

highlights.value: Joint Graduate Entrance Examination for Biology and Interdisciplinary Life Sciences

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
It is mandatory for candidates to fulfil the eligibility criteria of JGEEBILS 2025 to appear for the entrance exam. Check the below-mentioned eligibility criteria for JGEEBILS 2025.

  • For Ph.D program: Aspirants must have masters in basic science (M.Sc. Physics/Chemistry/any branch of Biology) or any professional master's degree (M.Pharma./M.Tech.), or a 4-year degree program (e.g. MBBS, BDS). Students holding M.Sc in a non-Biology-allied discipline such as Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics / Computer Science, and who wish to obtain an M.Sc. in Biology, will be offered the option of enrolling in the I-Ph.D. programme at the time of joining.

  • For I-Ph.D./M.Sc.: Aspirants should have bachelors in any basic science (Physics/Chemistry/any branch of Biology) OR any 4-year degree program that awards Bachelor's degree including B.Tech., B.E., B.V.Sc., B.Pharma. (4-year course).

  • For M.Sc. (Wildlife Biology & Conservation): Aspirants must have a Bachelor’s degree in any discipline (with a minimum of 50% in core subjects) and a strong interest in wildlife research and conservation. Candidates from Central, South and Southeast Asian countries, with similar qualifications, are also eligible to apply.

application_process.html_content:
Candidates who fulfil the eligibility criteria can submit the JGEEBILS  application form 2025 on or before the last date. The detailed process is mentioned below.

  • JGEEBILS 2025 Registration Process: In this step, candidates need to register on the official website and enter basic details such as the correct email ID, mobile number, programme, and others. Verify all the details and submit them. After successful registration, A confirmation message will be sent to the registered mobile number and email ID mentioning login credentials. 

  • Filling out the application form: After login in, click on the application form link and fill in all the details carefully. 

  • Uploading the documents: Candidates will have to upload the essential documents such as a passport-size photograph, and signature at the time of filling out the application form.

  • Students applying under the fee waiver category need to upload a scanned copy of the recommendation letter from the Principal/HOD of the college.

  • Those applying under the disability category need to upload a scanned copy of the disability certificate.

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Directorate of Medical Education and Training (DMET) conducts the Odisha BSc Nursing 2024 in online mode. The state level BSc nursing exam will grant admission to government and private nursing colleges in Odisha.  The authority releases the Odisha BSc nursing application form online. 

The DMET conducted the Odisha B.Sc nursing 2024 exam on July 20. The authority announced the Odisha B.Sc nursing 2024 exam date along with the information brochure on the official website, dohodisha.nic.in. Aspirants who fill out the Odisha B.Sc nursing application form 2024 before the closing date will be issued the Odisha B.Sc nursing 2024 admit card. 

The Odisha BSc nursing exam 2024 was conducted in the English language and consists of 100 MCQs. As per the Odisha BSc Nursing exam pattern, the duration of the test is 2 hours and there is no negative marking. After the successful completion of the exam, the Odisha B.Sc nursing 2024 result is declared by the conducting authority. Students who will qualify for the exam will be invited to take part in the Odisha B.Sc nursing 2024 counselling for admission. 

Odisha BSc Nursing 2024 counselling session will be conducted online for admission to the BSc Nursing program in the state. The seat allotment during the Odisha BSc Nursing counselling 2024 will be done on the grounds of the scores obtained by the candidates in the entrance exam, their rank, choice filled during the choice-filling session and seat availability. Eligible candidates can read more details on the Odisha BSc Nursing 2024 exam below.

highlights.value: Directorate of Medical Education and Training (DMET)

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Applicants appearing for the Odisha B.Sc nursing 2024 can check the eligibility guidelines for different courses from the table mentioned below. 

  • The candidate must be a citizen of India.

  • Candidates must have passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Biology as the mandatory subjects with a minimum of 45% marks.

  • The applicants should be at least 17 years old by December 31, 2024. The upper age limit is set at 35 years as of December 31, 2024.

  • The exam is exclusively open to female aspirants. However, males and transgender individuals can seek eligibility only through management quota seats.

application_process.html_content:
Mentioned below is the process for filling up the application form for Odisha post basic B.Sc. nursing 2024:

  • The first step is to visit the official website of Odisha B.Sc Nursing 2024 i.e. odisha.nic.in.

  • Proceed by clicking on the applicant login and completing the registration process. This entails entering the email address and mobile number for registration purposes. 

  • An OTP will be sent for verification. 

  • Following this, log in and diligently fill out the application form with all the academic details. Exercise caution while providing this information, as there will be no opportunity for later modifications.

  • Next, upload the signature and photograph onto the Odisha B.Sc Nursing 2024 application form. 

  • Once the form is filled out, the requisite fees must be paid. 

  • It is imperative to obtain a hard copy of the Odisha B.Sc nursing 2024 application form.

admit_card.html_content:
The hall ticket for Odisha B.Sc Nursing 2024 is scheduled to be issued a fortnight prior to the examination. It is imperative for aspirants to have their admit card in possession to gain entry to the examination venue on the day of the test. In addition to the personal information of the applicants, the admit card will also feature pertinent details regarding the exam schedule and the location of the test centre. 

How to download the B.Sc nursing Odisha 2024 admit card?

  • Go to the DMET website.

  • Select the Odisha B.Sc nursing admit card link.

  • Enter the registration number and password.

  • The admit card will be displayed on the screen.

  • Afterwards, applicants can proceed to download and print the admit card for the examination.

counselling_process.html_content:
The Odisha BSc Nursing 2024 counselling will be conducted online by DMET. During the counselling session, aspirants will have to register, pay the fee and fill in their choice of course and colleges. Please note that aspirants can fill as many colleges as they want in priority order and lock the choices before the last date. 

The authority will allot the seats in the Odisha BSc Nursing counselling 2024 based on the choices filled by the candidates during the choice-filling session, rank secured in the entrance exam and seat availability. Once the Odisha BSc counselling seat allotment list is published, students who secured the seat will have to report to the college/institution to lock it. During reporting, aspirants will have to furnish original documents and pay the course fees.

faqs.question: How can I prepare for the Odisha B.Sc nursing Exam?
faqs.answer: Applicants can prepare for the exam by studying the prescribed syllabus, practising the previous year's question papers, and taking mock tests. It's also beneficial to refer to standard textbooks and study materials.

faqs.question: What is the Odisha BSc Nursing 2024 exam fee?
faqs.answer: The fee for the BSc Nursing application form in Odisha is Rs 1000.

faqs.question: Who conducts the Odisha BSc Nursing 2024 exam?
faqs.answer: The nursing entrance exam in Odisha is conducted by the Directorate of Medical Education and Training (DMET).

exam_name: CPNET - Combined Paramedical, Pharmacy and Nursing Entrance Test
conducting_body: Uttar Pradesh University of Medical Sciences

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Combined Paramedical, Pharmacy, and Nursing Entrance Test, commonly known as CPNET, is a state-level examination conducted by the UPUMS, Saifai to facilitate admissions into all government and private institutions affiliated to UPUMS Saifai for the B.Pharm, GNM, and ANM courses.

As per the latest update, the CPNET 2024 counselling dates have been released. The registration window was opened from August 23 to 26, 2024.  The CPNET result was declared on August 23. The admit card 2024 was released on July 26 at the official website, upums.ac.in. The CPNET 2024 exam date was July 31. The CPNET 2024 is conducted in the English language for 2 hours in online mode and will consist of 100 MCQs. After the successful completion of the exam, the CPNET 2024 result is declared by the conducting authority.  Those who will qualify for the exam will be invited to the CPNET 2024 counselling session. which will be conducted online. Through CPNET 2024 scores, admissions will be granted to B.Pharm, ANM, and GNM courses.

highlights.value: Combined Paramedical, Pharmacy and Nursing Entrance Test
Uttar Pradesh University of Medical Sciences

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates appearing for the CPNET 2024 can check the eligibility guidelines for the different courses mentioned below. 

  • The candidate must be a resident of Uttar Pradesh and possess regional domicile as a prerequisite.
  • However, if the applicant holds an intermediate or graduation degree from Uttar Pradesh, he/she can apply even without the domicile.
  • The applicants should be at least 17 years old. The upper age limit is set at 35 years for all the candidates who wish to appear for GNM.
  • As for the ANM course, candidates must be 30 years or older to be considered.
  • Candidates must have passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Biology as the mandatory subjects with a minimum of 45% marks (Unreserved) and 40% (Reserved).

application_process.html_content:
Candidates interested in appearing for the CPNET exam must go through a systematic application process. 

Steps to be followed to fill up the application form

Step 1: Visit the website, upums.ac.in

Step 2: Click on “Click here for New Registration” and register with the name, Date of Birth, Email ID, and mobile number 

Step 3: After successful registration, candidates will receive the User ID & Password on his/her registered mobile number and Email ID. 

Step 4:  Log out and click on “Click here to log in for Registered User” with the allotted user ID and password.” The following details need to be completed during the filling up of the application form. 

(a) Personal Details (Communication details, Category, and other required personal details) 

(b) Qualification Details 

(c) Declaration and Documents Upload (photo and signature)

(d) Fee payment

Step 5: Deposit the requisite application fees as per your category. 

Step 6: Take a printout of this CPNET 2024 application form for future reference.

admit_card.html_content:
The authority releases the CPNET 2024 hall tickets for registered aspirants. Candidates can download their CPNET admit card 2024 from the official website, upums.ac.in. The CPNET 2024 admit card contains vital information such as the candidate's name, photograph, examination centre, date, and time. Candidates must carry a printed copy of their admit card along with a valid photo ID to the examination centre.

How to download the CPNET 2024 admit card?

  • Open the official website of UPUMS and click on the link provided for downloading the admit card.
  • Enter the application number and the rest of the details in it
  • Once the admit card is displayed, cross-check it and download the same
  • Take a printout of the admit card once you have cross-checked the details

counselling_process.html_content:
After the result declaration, the authority will release the first merit list of the candidates who qualified in the CPNET 2024 with a Common Merit Rank. The candidate will have to book the seat online as per his/her choice by making a payment of Rs. 500 (non-refundable/ non-adjustable).

The candidate will have to secure a seat by paying (online) an amount of Rs. 5,000/- for seat locking (to be adjusted or deducted from admission fees of the respective institute, forfeitable or non-refundable if the candidate leaves this course/documents mismatch during physical verification at respective Institute) if the allotted seat satisfies his/her choice. 

Candidates may skip to pay or lock/confirm the seat and may participate in a second counselling if it does not satisfy his/her choice of course/institution.

Steps for CPNET 2024 Counselling and Seats Allocation

  • Post the declaration of the result, the option to join and preference of courses will be available. Candidates will have to register for the CPNET 2024 counselling by making a payment of Rs.500.

  • The admission cell will allot the seat from the candidate’s preferred choice of Course and Institute based on Common Merit Rank and respective Categories/ Sub-Categories and display the allotment list on the website.

  • If the candidate agrees to take admission to the allotted course then he/she will have to deposit Rs.29500 online for the Degree course and Rs 25000 for a diploma course. 

  • If the fee is not deposited in the prescribed time period, assuming that the candidate is not interested in admission, this seat will be allotted to another candidate as per rules and no claim of the previous student will be entertained.

faqs.question: What is the exam duration of the CPNET 2024 exam?
faqs.answer: The CPNET 2024 exam duration is 2 hours.

faqs.question: What is the difficulty level of the CPNET 2024 exam?
faqs.answer: The difficulty level is easy to moderate. The questions asked are generally of the 10 + 2 standard.

exam_name: INI SS - Institute of National Importance Super Specialty Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The All India Institute of Medical Sciences, (AIIMS) conducts the Institute of National Importance Super-Specialty Entrance Test (INI-SS). The exam is held twice a year for the January and July sessions in online (CBT) mode for admission to 365 DM, 231 M.Ch. 29 MD (Hospital Administration) seats.

As per the latest update, AIIMS New Delhi has released INI SS open round seat allocation result at aiimsexams.ac.in. Candidates can report and submit their documents till August 20. Earlier, the INI SS July session round 3 counselling seat allotment result was declared on July 23, 2024. Candidates who were granted seats in INI SS round 3 counselling seat allotment result for July session had to report at the allotted institute on or before July 30, 2024. INI SS 2024 July session round 2 counselling result was declared on July 9. Candidates could report and submit their documents till July 16. The round 1 counselling result was announced on June 19. 

The INI SS 2024 result was declared on May 4. The admit cards were available on the official website aiimsexams.ac.in from April 22. AIIMS, New Delhi closed the application form for INI SS 2024 for the July session at aiimsexams.ac.in. The last date to fill the INI SS 2024 application form was April 10. The authority uploaded the INI SS 2024 information brochure. INI SS 2024 July session exam was held on April 27. The exam was held for admission to DM/M.Ch./MD Hospital Administration Courses at Institutes of National Importance (INI), AIIMS New Delhi including all new AIIMS, JIPMER Puducherry, PGIMER Chandigarh, NIMHANS Bengaluru, and Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences & Technology (SCTIMST) Thiruvananthapuram.

The result for INI SS 2024 result was published in PDF format on the official website. Those who qualify for the exam are eligible to participate in the INI SS 2024 July session counselling. A total of three rounds will be conducted in the INI SS 2024 counselling during which aspirants will have to register and fill in the choice of course and colleges. The seat allotment for INI SS 2024 July counselling will be held on the grounds of INI SS rank, choices filled by the candidates during the counselling and seat availability.

highlights.value: Institute of National Importance Super Specialty Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
INI SS 2024 eligibility criteria for DM/M.Ch 

To get admission to DM/M.Ch. seats through the common entrance test, candidates must meet the INI SS eligibility criteria 2024 as laid down by the authority. 

  • Candidates must have completed the requisite qualification, degree 

  • Educational Qualification: Candidates must possess the educational qualification mentioned in the information brochure. 

  • Age relaxation: The age relaxation offered by the authority varies for different categories which can be referred to in the table below.

Eligibility criteria MD (Hospital Administration)

  • Candidates must have a minimum of three years of experience in government hospitals or five years of experience in general practice. 

  • Candidates belonging to the UR/OBC/EWS/Sponsored category must have obtained 55% in aggregate in MBBS whereas those belonging to SC/ST must have obtained a minimum of 50% marks in aggregate. 

  • Candidates must be registered with the Central /State Medical Registration Council. 

  • Candidates who have graduated from foreign universities must fill in their FMGE exam marks in the application form.

application_process.html_content:
The steps to fill INI SS application form 2024 are as follows:

  1. Registration: Go to aiimsexam.ac.in and register for INI SS 2024 July session by entering the details asked in the portal. 

  2. Filling the application form: After registration, candidates will be redirected to the application form. Enter the personal details, educational qualification, contact details, and FMGE screening marks (if applicable). 

  3. Uploading of documents: In the third step, upload the documents as specified in the brochure. 

  4. Paying INI SS 2024 application fee: Pay the registration fee through Debit card/ Credit card/ Net banking. The INI SS 2024 application form fee is given in the table below.

admit_card.html_content:
The authority released the INI SS admit card 2024 on April 22. Candidates can download their INI SS admit card 2024 from the official website aiimsexams.ac.in. Candidates need to login using their candidate ID and password. In the admit card of INI SS details regarding exam date & time, exam centre, reporting time, candidate’s name, important guidelines and other information will be provided. 

Candidates must carry the INI SS 2024 admit card to the examination centre along with a valid photo ID proof (Aadhaar card/PAN card/Driving licence/Voter ID card).

counselling_process.html_content:
INI CET provides admission to various courses such as uch as Doctor of Medicine (MD), Master of Surgery (MS), Master of Dental Surgery (MDS), Doctorate of Medicine (DM), Master of Chirurgiae (MCh).  INI SS 2024 counselling will be conducted by AIIMS in online mode. Candidates included in the merit list will be eligible to participate in the counselling process. To participate in the counselling, candidates will have to register online and fill in choices for colleges and specialities. 

The authority will conduct a total of 3 rounds for INI SS 2024 seat allocation. After the allocation of seats, candidates will have to choose any one option from the below-mentioned options.  

  • Option 1. Accept the allotted Institute and do not wish to participate in further rounds of INI SS 2024 counselling.
  • Option 2. Accept the allotted Institute but want to participate in the next round of counselling.
  • In case a candidate opts for option 2, he/she will have to accept the seat allotted in this round. The seat allotted in the first round will be considered vacant.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The INI SS 2024 exam will be conducted in online (CBT) mode in two stages. Stage I will comprise of 80 questions that need to be answered in 90 minutes. For every correct answer, candidates will be awarded one mark and for every incorrect answer, one-third mark will be deducted. Stage II will be conducted for those candidates who apply for AIIMS and will be of 20 marks only. 

Salient features 

Details

Type of questions

Objective type of questions of single correct choice.

Marking scheme

  • +1 mark for every correct answer 

  • -⅓ mark for every incorrect answer

  • 0 marks for unanswered/marked for review

Syllabus

The question paper will consist of questions from the General/Basic component of the qualifying educational qualification and from sub- specialty/systems/component the specialty/course for which the examination is being conducted.

Qualifying Criteria in Stage I

50 percent (%)


Stage II: Applicable to all AIIMS only 

  1. Candidates must secure 50% marks or more in stage I. 

  2. Candidates must have registered online for AIIMS seats in respective specialty/course.

  3. Candidates fulfilling the AIIMS eligibility criteria will be called for departmental clinical/practical/lab-based assessment related to subspecialty/systems/component of the specialty/course for which the candidate has applied. 

  4. Candidates must obtain 50% marks or more in stage I and stage II combined to qualify for AIIMS seat allocation.

faqs.question: From where to download the INI SS 2024 admit card?
faqs.answer: Candidates could download the INI SS admit card 2024 from the official website. The authority not did send the admit card to the candidates individually.

faqs.question: What is the tie-breaking rule for INI SS 2024?
faqs.answer: If two or more candidates score equal marks in the INI SS 2024 exam, candidates older in age will be placed high in the merit list.

faqs.question: How many questions are asked in INI SS?
faqs.answer: As per the exam pattern, a total of 80 questions were asked in the INI SS 2024 January session exam. Candidates had to answer the same in 90 minutes.

faqs.question: Can I register offline for INI SS 2024 July session?
faqs.answer: No, candidates could only register online for INI SS 2024 July session at aiimsexams.ac.in.

faqs.question: Who conducts INI SS?
faqs.answer: AIIMS, New Delhi conducted INI SS 2024 July session exam on April 27.

exam_name: PGIMER BSc Nursing

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER), Chandigarh conducts the BSc nursing exam in online mode. Through the PGIMER BSc nursing entrance examination, admission will be granted to 93 BSc (4 Years) and 62 BSc post-basic seats. The PGIMER BSc nursing 2024 exam was conducted on July 26. As per the latest update, the result of PGIMER BSc nursing has been declared on August 9, 2024. 

100 multiple-choice questions (MCQs) are asked in the PGIMER BSc nursing exam. The total duration of the exam will be 90 minutes. As per the PGIMER marking scheme for BSc nursing, one mark is given for each correct answer while 0.25 mark is deducted for each wrong answer. 

Based on the entrance exam, PGIMER publishes the results. The BSc nursing result PDF mentions the candidate’s name, roll number, category, percentile score and overall rank. Candidates who are included in the merit list can participate in the PGIMER BSc nursing 2024 counselling process. The selected candidates need to pay the admission fee and get their documents verified at the institute.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
All candidates wishing to appear for the entrance exam for PGIMER 2024 BSc nursing should check the eligibility criteria to know the age limit, qualification details, nationality and others before applying. PGIMER BSc nursing eligibility 2024 criteria can be checked below:

PGIMER BSc Nursing (4 Years) Eligibility Criteria:

  • Candidates must have passed 12th with Physics, Chemistry, Biology and English or any other examination as equivalent examination with at least 50% marks in aggregate.

  • Candidates appearing in 10+2 in the current year are eligible to apply. But they will be issued admit cards only if they submit the Class 12 marks sheet to the Principal, 10 days before the commencement of the entrance exam.

  • Candidates must not be more than 25 years and not less than 17 years on September 1, 2024.

PGIMER BSc Nursing (Post-Basic) Eligibility Criteria:

  • Candidates must have passed 10+2 or equivalent from a recognized Board/University.

  • Candidates with a General Nursing and Midwifery with a minimum of 50% aggregate can also apply.

  • Registered nurses and registered midwives qualified from a recognized Institute & State Nursing Council approved by the Indian Nursing Council (INC) are also eligible to apply.

  • Candidates must not be more than 45 years as on September 1, 2024 i.e. those born before September 1, 1977 are not eligible.

application_process.html_content:
In order to complete the PGIMER BSC nursing application form, candidates should follow the given steps:

Step 1 - Registration

Eligible candidates must visit the official website of PGIMER Chandigarh. Candidates will have to click on the ‘new user registration’ and fill the mandatory details asked for such as email ID, mobile number and password. Candidates must save their user ID, application number and password for login purposes.

Step 2 - Filling the Basic Details

Candidates will have to log in using credentials such as user Id and password. Enter details such as personal, academic, contact details, address and other information. 

Step 3 - Uploading Documents, Photographs & Signature 

After the successful completion of the registration process, candidates will have to upload the required documents and recent passport-size scanned photographs in the prescribed format as per the specifications mentioned.

Step 4 - Payment of Application Fee

After reviewing the application form, candidates will have to pay the application form fees which can be paid online via net banking/credit card/debit card. The PGIMER BSC nursing application fee is different for each category. The category-wise PGIMER BSC nursing fees is mentioned on this page. 

Step 5 - Printout of application form

After submission of the application form, candidates can take out a printout of the registration slip for future reference. It must be noted that candidates will not be able to change details after the submission of the application form.

How to download the PGIMER BSc nursing admit card?

The selected candidates will have to bring the original documents for the verification process and pay the course fee.

faqs.answer: Selected candidates should pay the admission fee on the spot after the counselling round. Failing which, the selection will be treated as cancelled and seats will be offered to the candidates next on the waiting list.
