exam_name: AIIMS MSc Nursing - AIIMS MSc Nursing

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi conducts the MSc nursing exam. Through the AIIMS MSc nursing entrance exam admission to MSc nursing seats is granted in different institutions of AIIMS such as AIIMS New Delhi, AIIMS Raipur, AIIMS Rishikesh, AIIMS Bhubaneswar, AIIMS Bhopal, AIIMS Jodhpur, AIIMS Patna, AIIMS Gorakhpur, AIIMS Kalyani, AIIMS Deoghar, AIIMS Bibinager and AIIMS Mangalagiri. 

As per the latest update, the AIIMS, Delhi has released AIIMS MSc nursing counselling 2024 round 2 seat allotment result on July 30. Candidates who will be granted seats in the online AIIMS MSc nursing counselling 2024 must report at the allotted institute from July 31 to August 6 and submit the application fee and required documents. 

The authority declared the result of the MSc Nursing entrance exam on June 25 in pdf format. The AIIMS MSc Nursing result includes the candidate's roll number, percentile, candidate category, and overall rank. Based on the AIIMS MSc Nursing result 2024, online seat allocation for all the participating AIIMS institutes will be done. 

Earlier, the admit card for MSc nursing. Candidates could download the MSc nursing admit card 2024 by entering their registration number and password. The authority closed the AIIMS MSc nursing application form 2024 on April 26. The AIIMS, New Delhi released the AIIMS MSc nursing application form 2024 at the official website, aiimsexams.ac.in. Aspiring candidates wishing to take the AIIMS MSc nursing exam 2024 must complete an online application process involving two stages: basic registration and final registration. Along with the application form, AIIMS also released the MSc 2024 brochure mentioning the important dates and details of the exam. 

AIIMS MSc nursing exam 2024 was conducted on June 15. Only registered candidates received the AIIMS MSc nursing admit card 2024. As per the MSc nursing exam pattern 2024, candidates had to answer 90 multiple-choice questions in 90 minutes. Following the exam, the authority released AIIMS MSc nursing result 2024.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Before applying for the MSc nursing entrance exam, all candidates must thoroughly review the eligibility criteria for AIIMS MSc Nursing 2024. These criteria encompass academic prerequisites, pass percentages and other essential details. The specific AIIMS MSc nursing eligibility criteria 2024 can be checked below. 

  • Candidates must possess a Bachelor's degree in B.Sc. (Hons.) Nursing /B.Sc. Nursing (Post-Certificate)/Post-Basic /B Sc. Nursing to apply 

  • Candidates belonging to the General/OBC category should secure a minimum of 60% in the qualifying exam and those belonging to SC/ST should secure 55%

  • Candidates should possess registration as a Nurse, RN, or RM (Registered Nurse, Registered Midwife) with any State Nursing Council

application_process.html_content:
The registration process for AIIMS MSc Nursing 2024 is conducted online by the authorities in two stages i.e Basic and FInal registration. Both of these stages are explained step by step below. 

Stage 1: Process for Basic Registration through PAAR

To complete the Basic Registration through PAAR, candidates are required to follow the below-mentioned steps. 

Step 1: Filling the basic details

Candidates who have not done Basic Registration are required to select ‘New Basic Registration’ to complete the basic registration. Candidates are required to fill in their details such as: 

  • Personal details: Candidate’s name, father’s name, mother’s name, address, date of birth, category 

  • Contact information

  • Correspondence address 

After submitting the basic details, the registration ID and password are sent to the email address and mobile number provided by the candidates. Candidates are required to use these details to complete step 2 of the Basic Registration process. 

Note: The above information cannot be changed once submitted. Therefore, candidates are advised to check the entered details carefully. 

Step 2: Uploading of images 

In the next step, candidates need to log in using the registration ID and password generated in step 1 and upload the images of their photograph, signature and left thumb impression within the specified format. The specifications for the same are provided below. 

Particulars

Specifications 

Photograph

  • Passport size colour photograph with white background only but without border

  • Photo should not be more than 6 months old

  • Dimension: 3.5X4.5 cm

  • Size: 50-100 KB

  • Format: .jpg/.jpeg/.gif/.png

Signature

  • Signature must be on a white background in blue or black ink

  • Signature must not be in capitals or just initials or have overwriting

  • Dimension: 6 X 3 cm

  • Size: 20-100 KB

  • Format: .jpg/.jpeg/.gif/.png

Left thumb impression 

  • Left thumb impression to be within box of 4*3 cm

  • Left thumb impression must be in a blue/black ink pad. Ink should have covered the entire thumb

  • Size: 20-100 KB

  • Format: .jpg/.jpeg/.gif/.png


Step 3: Print the AIIMS MSc nursing registration form 

After filling in the basic details, candidates are required to save the application form. The registration form should be downloaded and printed for future reference.

Status and Correction of AIIMS MSc Nursing 2024 registration form: 

Once the details of Basic Registration are submitted, the authority scrutinises the registration form for quality of images and other specifications. Applicants whose submissions are not accepted are required to rectify the deficiencies before proceeding to the second and final stages of the application process.

Stage 2: Final Registration for AIIMS MSc Nursing Application Form 2024

Step 1: Generation of Code

Applicants who have successfully completed the basic registration must proceed to the second stage of the AIIMS MSc nursing 2024 application process to generate the required code. 

Step 2: Entering the qualification details 

In the next step, candidates are required to fill in qualification details.

Step 3: Fee payment 

Moving forward to the next step, candidates are required to pay the application fee for AIIMS MSc Nursing 2024. The application fees for AIIMS MSc Nursing 2024 differ based on categories. Payment can be made through various modes, including net banking, debit card or credit card. The AIIMS MSc nursing application form fee is mentioned in the table below. 

Application fee 

Category 

Amount 

General/ OBC (NCL)

Rs 2000

SC/ ST/ EWS

Rs 1600

PWBD

Exempted 


Step 4: Choice of exam city

After paying the application form fee, candidates are required to select their exam city based on availability. The option to choose the exam city becomes accessible after the entire AIIMS MSc nursing application form 2024 process.

admit_card.html_content:
The authority releases AIIMS MSc nursing admit card 2024 for successfully registered candidates. To access the AIIMS MSc nursing admit card 2024, candidates need to log in with their credentials. AIIMS MSc nursing hall tickets 2024 will not be sent by post. It is essential for candidates to review the details on the AIIMS MSc Nursing 2024 admit card for any inaccuracies before printing it. 

Steps to download AIIMS MSc Nursing 2024 admit card 

  • Visit the official website of AIIMS, aiimsexams.ac.in

  • Login by clicking on the link to download admit card

  • Enter the Registration ID and password

  • Download the AIIMS MSc nursing admit card displayed on the screen 

  • Check for the discrepancies 

  • If not, save a soft copy for future reference and print a copy

counselling_process.html_content:
After the announcement of AIIMS MSc nursing result 2024, the authority conducts seat allocation processes in online and offline mode. During AIIMS MSc nursing counselling 2024, qualified candidates are required to fill and lock their choices of courses and institutions. A detailed process of AIIMS MSc nursing 2024 counselling is described below. 

  • The authority will conduct the AIIMS MSc nursing seat allocation procedure in two rounds namely, the first and second rounds followed by a final open round. 

  • Seat allocation will be done based on the combined merit list published by the authority.

  • The final open round of seat allocation will be conducted in physical form. In this round, all candidates with marks at or above the 50th percentile will be eligible. 

  • Candidates have the flexibility to modify their choice of institutions and subjects in all rounds. However, during the final open round, any changes, including those within the same institution, can only be made after submitting a penalty amount in the form of a Demand Draft. 

  • Selected candidates will have to undergo a medical examination and if found medically fit will join the course after depositing the requisite fee. 

Note: Candidates who are currently enrolled in an MSc program in any subject (provided they have not yet completed it) will be considered for admission. However, such candidates are required to report to the respective institute and submit either their original documents or a Demand Draft of Rs 1,00,000 and a security deposit. The security deposit will be refunded upon submission of original documents within a 5-day period. 

If there are vacant seats after the final open round, these seats will be filled through a spot seat allotment round at the respective AIIMS individually.

faqs.answer: AIIMS, New Delhi is the competent authority that conducts the AIIMS MSc nursing entrance for admission to MSc nursing in all other AIIMS institutes.

faqs.answer: The exam duration of AIIMS MSc nursing entrance is 1 hour and 30 minutes.

faqs.answer: The question paper of AIIMS MSc nursing exam is asked in English language only. The exam is conducted in online mode.

faqs.answer: To get admission to MSc Nursing programmes in AIIMS Institutes of India, candidates need to qualify for the AIIMS MSc nursing entrance exam which is conducted annually.

exam_name: FMGE - Foreign Medical Graduates Examination

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
FMGE - Foreign Medical Graduate Examination is a screening test for medical graduates to be eligible to practice medicine in the country. FMGE exam is conducted biannually in June and December by the National Board of Examinations for Indian and Overseas Citizens of India (OCIs) to obtain the registration certificate from the National Medical Commission (NMC) or State Medical Council (SMC).

The National Board of Examinations (NBE) will relese FMGE application form 2024 for December session soon. Candidates will have to submit the FMGE application form 2024 before the last date. The NBE will issue the FMGE admit cards to the registered candidates only. 

FMGE 2024 December exam date will be announced by NBE. Soon after the exam, the authority releases the FMGE 2024 December result at natboard.edu.in. Candidates who qualified the FMGE exam can collect their FMGE pass certificate from the head office of NBEMS. 

As per the FMGE exam pattern, the test is divided into two parts - Part A and Part B. Each part has 150 questions, making a total of 300 questions. The questions in the FMGE exam are asked from the MBBS curriculum. As per the marking scheme, one mark is awarded for every correct answer, while there is no negative marking.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Foreign Medical Graduates (FMGs) are required to fulfil the following eligibility criteria of FMGE 2024 to be able to appear in the December session examination. Candidates can check the FMGE 2024 eligibility criteria listed below:

  • Candidates applying to FMGE must be either an Indian national or an Overseas Citizen of India (OCI).
  • Aspirants should obtain the necessary primary medical qualification and must obtain their MBBS degree before the ascertained period for a particular session. The MBBS degree of the FMGs must be awarded by institutions included in the World Directory of Medical Schools as listed by the World Health Organization (WHO) or an institution duly attested by the Indian embassy concerned for the candidates to be recognized as medical practitioners in India. 
  • All the FMGs are required to provide documents in support of the primary medical education from the foreign medical institution concerned.
  • Candidates with a postgraduate medical degree obtained in the countries of Canada, Australia, the United Kingdom, New Zealand and the United States of America need not appear in FMGE 2024 screening test as they can directly register with MCI/SMC.

application_process.html_content:
Here are the steps to fill FMGE 2024 application form. 

  • Candidates need to visit nbe.edu.in and click on the tab that says "FMGE December 2024. 
  • In the next step, all the necessary details pertaining to the application form for FMGE 2024 must be filled out by the candidates.
  • All the information provided in the FMGE application form must be correct, so candidates must thoroughly check the details before clicking on the 'Submit' button. 
  • The fee for the application form of FMGE 2024 which is Rs 6,195 (including GST) will be paid in the next step via Credit or Debit Card or net banking only.
  • The candidates will be required to check the confirmation box in order to ensure the successful submission of the FMGE 2024 application form. 

NOTE: Candidates who will successfully complete the application process of FMGE will receive a confirmation letter sent by NBE on their registered email IDs.

preparation_tips.html_content:
The FMGE holds significant importance as a screening test for international medical graduates seeking to practice medicine in India. Given its rigorous curriculum and extensive syllabus, a well-defined preparation strategy for the FMGE exam is imperative to achieve successful results. Check the FMGE preparation tips below. 

Tip 1: Make a study schedule 

Creating a practical study timetable is crucial for FMGE preparation. Aspiring foreign medical candidates should ensure their schedule aligns with the syllabus timeframe.  Setting realistic targets based on individual capabilities is essential, as overly ambitious goals can adversely impact performance.

Tip 2: Know the exam pattern 

To perform well in the FMGE 2024, candidates must familiarize themselves with the MBBS-based syllabus and understand the exam pattern.  Understanding the FMGE exam pattern help candidates to navigate and excel in this comprehensive assessment of medical competence.

Tip 3: Familiarize with the syllabus 

A comprehensive understanding of the FMGE syllabus is essential for effective exam preparation. Without knowledge of the included chapters, preparation efforts may be futile. 

Tip 4: Practice from mock tests

Effective FMGE preparation goes beyond covering the syllabus; candidates must engage in mock tests to enhance time management skills crucial for the actual exam. These tests, taken within the stipulated time frame, pinpoint areas for improvement and allow candidates to practice performing under time constraints, a valuable aspect of FMGE 2024 readiness. 

Tip 5: Prepare from best books 

An optimal approach to FMGE preparation involves consulting top-notch books and utilizing visual content. When selecting FMGE 2024 study materials, candidates should ensure that the chosen resources not only align with the best books available but also effectively elucidate fundamental concepts while comprehensively covering all relevant topics.

admit_card.html_content:
Check the steps to download the FMGE 2024 December session below.

  • Visit nbe.edu,in, and click on the FMGE December 2024 tab.

  • Upon reaching the FMGE 2024 website, click on the link admit card link.

  • Login entering your user ID and password

  • The admit card of FMGE December 2024 will be displayed on the screen

  • Verify all the details mentioned in FMGE admit card

  • Download and take a printout of the FMGE hall ticket 2024

cutoffs.html_content:
The minimum qualifying marks that the candidates appearing in the screening test, are required to obtain will be the FMGE cutoff of 2024. Candidates failing to meet the FMGE 2024 cutoff will be rendered disqualified and will not be able to register with the State Medical Council or NMC. 

The total score of FMGE is 300 (two papers of 150 marks each). NBE has set the cutoff of FMGE 2024 at 50%, i.e. a candidate will be required to obtain at least 150 out of 300 marks (in the two papers combined) so as to qualify for the exam.

exam_name: NEET PG - National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Post Graduate

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The National Board of Examinations (NBE) conducts the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Postgraduate exam, NEET PG 2024 for admission to around 26,168 Doctor of Medicine (MD), 13,649 Master of Surgery (MS) and 922 PG Diploma in 6,102 government, private, deemed/central universities. 

The registrations for round 1 NEET PG counselling 2024 started on September 20 at mcc.nic.in. The authority will release the official schedule of NEET PG counselling 2024 soon. Earlier, NBE released the NEET PG merit list for the 50% AIQ seats on September 4, 2024. The NEET PG 2024 scorecard was released at nbe.edu.in on August 30. After the declaration of the results, the MCC conducts the NEET PG 2024 counselling for admission to 50% All India Quota (AIQ), 50% state quota, 100% deemed/central universities, and ESIC/AFMS institutes. 

A total of 4 rounds of AIQ - round 1, round 2, mop-up round and stray vacancy round are conducted. During the NEET PG counselling 2024, candidates have to register, pay fees and fill out their choice of courses and colleges. Based on the choices filled by the graduates, NEET PG 2024 rank and seat availability, admission will be granted.

The NEET PG exam is held in a computer-based mode, wherein, candidates need to attempt a total of 200 multiple-choice questions in three hours and thirty minutes. As per the NEET PG marking scheme, four marks are awarded for every correct answer, while one mark is deducted for each incorrect response.

highlights.value: National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Post Graduate

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates who wish to appear for NBE NEET PG 2024, must check the required eligibility criteria below. 

  • A valid MBBS degree from an institution recognised by the Medical Council of India (MCI), and an MBBS degree or provisional certificate to that effect. 
  • Completion of the rotatory internship. 
  • Provisional or permanent medical registration certificate issued by MCI or a State Medical Council. This must be carried out on the day of the exam and during admission.
  • Candidates who have studied/qualified MBBS from Jammu & Kashmir are not eligible for All India 50% Quota seats. Only candidates who were nominated by the Government of India (under central pool seats) to study MBBS from Medical Colleges in Jammu & Kashmir shall be eligible for All India 50% quota seats. Such candidates must submit a duly signed affidavit declaring this.
  • Applicants who have completed their MBBS degree from outside India must have qualified for the Foreign Medical Graduate Examination (FMGE)

application_process.html_content:
NEET PG application form 2024 can be filled in the steps mentioned below. 

  • Visit nbe.edu.in and click on the NEET PG 2024 tab
  • Click on the 'new registration' tab and enter the asked details. 
  • User ID and password will be then, sent through SMS and Email
  • Fill out the application form - Personal Details, Qualification Details (MBBS / Primary Medical Qualification details, Internship Details, SMC/MCI Registration Details), Test Center Details
  • Upload a recent passport-size photograph (Maximum 80 Kb size, in JPG/JPEG format) and signature (Maximum 80 Kb size, in JPG/JPEG format) signature
  • Choose test city
  • Make a payment of fees in the online mode through debit/credit card or net banking.
  • Take a printout of the filled application form with the transaction ID printed on it.

Important: Test City will be confirmed only after payment of the fee is successful.

NEET PG Correction Window 2024

With the help of the correction window, applicants will be able to edit some details in their NEET PG 2024 application form. The details that can be edited during the NEET PG correction window include

  • Date of Birth 
  • Gender 
  • Category of the Candidate 
  • Physical Disability Status 
  • EWS status

The following details cannot be corrected in the NEET 2024 application form:

  • Name of the Candidate 
  • Mobile Number 
  • Email ID 
  • Testing City 
  • Nationality

For any query/clarification/assistance on NEET PG, candidates can write to NBE at neetpg@nbe.edu.in or call the NBE Candidate Care helpdesk Toll Free number - 1800 267 4003.

Note: The email should mention the name of the sender, application ID, correspondence address and mobile number.

preparation_tips.html_content:
The NEET PG 2024 will be conducted in online mode for admission to Doctor of Medicine (MD), Master of Surgery (MS) and PG Diploma in government, private, deemed/central universities. A proper preparation strategy boosts the confidence of the candidate making them mentally strong enough to face the examination with more determination. A few tips to prepare effectively for NEET PG 2024 exam are given below.

NEET PG preparation tips: 

  • Start preparing the NEET PG 2024 syllabus as early as possible 
  • Work on the clinical concepts first
  • Prepare every topic including those too which have less weightage
  • Practice the NEET PG previous year's question paper
  • Attempt NEET PG 2024 mock tests 
  • Keep yourself stress-free

admit_card.html_content:
Registered candidates will be able to download the NEET PG 2024 admit card by entering their user ID and password until the exam day. Upon downloading the admit card of NEET PG 2024, candidates will be required to affix a recent passport-sized photograph on the hall ticket.

Steps to download NEET PG admit card 2024

  • Go to the official website - nbe.edu.in and select the "NEET PG 2024" tab. 

  • Click on the "applicant login". 

  • Enter the user ID and password to log in

  • Click on the NEET PG 2024 admit card tab.

  • Verify the details mentioned in the hall ticket of NEET PG 2024

  • Download and take a printout of the NEET PG hall ticket 2024

counselling_process.html_content:
The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) is the conducting authority of the NEET PG 2024 for admission to 50% All India Quota (AIQ) seats, all deemed/central universities and ESIC/AFMS colleges. On the other hand, the state quota seat allotment process will be conducted by the respective state counselling authorities. Only qualified candidates will be eligible to participate in NEET PG 2024 counselling. 

All India Counselling of NEET PG 2024 include 

  • All India 50% quota
  • Medical Educational Institutions of Central Govt.
  • AFMS Institutions
  • Universities established by an act of Parliament
  • Deemed Universities

State Level NEET PG 2024 counselling include 

  • State Quota Seats in Government/Private Medical Institutions in the State Institutions established by State. Govt.
  •  Universities established by an Act of State / Union Territory Legislature, Municipal Bodies Trust, society, Company or Minority Institutions

Once the seats are allotted, aspirants need to provide an option for up-gradation and also download the allotment letter. Thereafter, report to the allotted college with the relevant documents.

Only the qualified candidates who will secure the minimum cutoff percentile will be required to register with the counselling bodies. Two rounds of NEET PG 2024 counselling will be held. 

The mop-up round of NEET PG counselling will be conducted only for Deemed and Central Universities. Candidates allotted seats through NEET PG counselling 2024 will be required to report to the allotted colleges within the stipulated time for admission purposes.
